title: WCAS GERMAN 211-0-20 German Culture through Film

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is an introduction to German culture through the lens of German film. We will analyze aspects of German history, society, politics, and aesthetic movements by focusing on nine significant German films made between 1920 and 2015. By studying selected elements of film, including genre, production and reception contexts, actors, directors, film history, and central thematic and formal elements of film, students will also learn basic skills of film analysis. This course is entirely in German and emphasizes developing cultural knowledge and German language skills.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture and discussion with active student participation, including group work. The course will be conducted entirely in German.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation; Blackboard participation; film analyses; in-class quizzes; several shorter writing assignments; exam.
